comments.body: Could you point me to the place where HTMLElement is being augmented? I didn't found the documentation or example where this happens; otherwise I believe this is incorrect.
The author of Dropzone has described this possibility when asked but has not added it to the documentation yet: https://github.com/enyo/dropzone/issues/180#issuecomment-19875928
This seems fine since it's mentioned in doc
I can't find it in doc, but fine for me

I don't see `totalChunkCount` in doc
Can you explain more?

The docs are not very complete; I don't think they were fully updated after the chunked uploads feature was added.  There are actually a few more fields in there.  The contents of `progress` doesn't seem to make sense, and `chunked: boolean` only appears when running in chunked mode.

![Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 9 19 31 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53452532/82471142-26c01980-9a7b-11ea-99c3-b59d12fc1c3c.png)

For a non-chunked upload, the fields are `bytesSent`, `filename`, `progress`, `total`, and `uuid`:

![Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 9 24 17 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53452532/82471564-b2d24100-9a7b-11ea-9a8d-86e364f0fdff.png)

At least in our code base, we make heavy use of attaching additional data to either `DropzoneFile` or in this case, `DropzoneMockFile`. There are also a few answers to common problems solved by this. It's useful, since this file goes through all the callbacks which users of the library can override, so I added it this option here.

Alternatively, I assume, there's always the option to have `type MyMockFile = DropzoneMockFile & MyCustomFile`?

I am fine with it
Unless extra property causes bugs, no point disallowing it

TBH, I have the same problem with `DropzoneFile`. We attach some additional methods to it, for example for [checking the resolution](https://stackoverflow.com/a/30850495/1928168).

Would you, in general, be open to a PR adding additional fields to `DropzoneFile` as well? I was a bit hesitant, since in JS you can just attach anything everywhere, while we generally want more strict checks in TS.

Especially since Dropzone is very lax when accepting a "`file`". For a lot of operations, not every attribute is necessary.

Unless the additional attributes would cause bugs
I am fine adding open ended signatures
But then I won't accept any specific non-official properties

Source code says it also [needs `imageURL`](https://gitlab.com/meno/dropzone/-/blob/v5.7.0/src/dropzone.js#L1679-1681), but that's not correct. It's never read and `imageURL` is passed into `displayExistingFile` directly.
Ya that might be a outdated code comment
